title: Market Basket launches its own beer — here’s where to buy it
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Market Basket has launched its own beer, partnering with Vermont's Zero Gravity Beer to create the 'More For Your Dollar' lager.
The 'More For Your Dollar' 12-pack is priced at $12.99 and available at select Market Basket locations in Massachusetts, Maine, and New Hampshire.
The beer launch follows the ousting of CEO Arthur T. Demoulas, a move opposed by many Boston.com readers.

title: As SJC mulls involvement in public defender work stoppage, here’s where things stand
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Massachusetts public defenders' work stoppage, starting in May, leaves over 900 defendants without representation despite a modest pay raise.
The Supreme Judicial Court considers allowing temporary pay raises for court-appointed attorneys to address the ongoing work stoppage.
The SJC hears arguments on whether intervening in attorney pay violates the separation of powers, with a decision months away.

title: Reese Witherspoon visits Boston bookstore
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Reese Witherspoon visited Beacon Hill Books and Cafe in Boston to sign her bestselling novel, 'Gone Before Goodbye'.
Witherspoon attended Harvard Business School for a case discussion, reflecting on her film 'Legally Blonde' set at Harvard.
Her visit included discussions about Reese’s Book Club, promoting woman-centered stories by female authors monthly.

title: GOP lawmakers pushing Healey for info on aide arrested in cocaine bust
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: LaMar Cook, aide to Gov. Maura Healey, was arrested for cocaine trafficking and subsequently fired.
Republican lawmakers question Healey's hiring vetting process, citing Cook's past criminal charges including a 2001 assault incident.
GOP candidates demand independent investigation and improved vetting after Cook's arrest, criticizing Healey's hiring practices.

title: 2 teens killed in New Bedford crash identified
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Gabriel Bertolino Siqueira, 17, and Anne Urbanski Santos De Carvalho, 15, identified as victims in New Bedford crash.
The single-car accident occurred on Route 140 South; Gabriel and Anne were ejected from the vehicle.
The crash investigation is ongoing; the 18-year-old driver from Dartmouth hospitalized with non-life-threatening injuries.

title: BPD releases multiple photos of baseball-capped commercial burglary suspect
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Boston police released photos of a suspect involved in commercial burglaries starting August 21, seeking public assistance for identification.
The suspect reportedly used a pry tool to access downtown businesses, stealing credit cards, cash, and electronics.
Boston, Cambridge, and Northeastern University police report similar break-ins; public urged to contact Boston police with tips.

title: Report: Mike Vrabel’s former team was ‘unwilling’ to trade with Patriots
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: The Tennessee Titans were reportedly unwilling to trade with the New England Patriots during the NFL trade deadline.
Titans' owner Amy Adams Strunk allegedly carries resentment from Mike Vrabel's departure, impacting trade decisions with his new team.
The Patriots pursued trades, but ultimately made no significant moves by the trade deadline, according to coach Mike Vrabel.

title: Following a career night, Josh Minott isn’t taking his starting role for granted
author: Aidan Buchanan
bullets: Josh Minott scores a career-high 21 points in Celtics' 136-107 win over the Wizards.
Minott, a former Timberwolves player, has become a starter, averaging 9.1 points in 22.5 minutes.
Teammates praise Minott's competitiveness and energy, crucial for team's performance and chemistry.

title: Are the New England Patriots back? Here’s what 200 readers said.
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Boston.com readers are divided on the Patriots' progress, with 43% saying they're back and 44% choosing 'too early to tell'.
Quarterback Drake Maye is gaining attention and is considered a potential MVP, impressing fans alongside coach Mike Vrabel.
Critics say the Patriots' six-game win streak hasn't faced strong opponents, with upcoming games viewed as better tests.

title: Questions swirl after bus aide allegedly assaults autistic student from Cambridge
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: A bus aide was placed on leave after being filmed restraining and calling an autistic student 'the devil' on an NRT bus.
The incident, investigated by DCF, left the child's family angry after the aide continued working the same week.
Cambridge Public Schools prohibits the aide from transporting students and filed a child endangerment report with DCF.
